Prior to that, he led Microsoft Business Solutions and worked on the engineering side of the company's server group. In deciding who should take the business forward, we wanted someone with the right mix of leadership, vision and hard-core engineering chops, Steve Ballmer wrote in a Feb. 9 e-mail to employees. "We wanted someone who could define the future of business computing and further expand our ability to bring the cloud to business customers and developers in game-changing ways.

Eric Schmidt 's departure had been a long time coming, says Charles Arthur in The Guardian: After slipups with search, Street View and Android, it's clear that Google needs tighter control at the top- and Eric Schmidt is not the man for the job. What of Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin ? He is said to be focusing on strategic projects and is particularly interested in social networking. The investments, which drew their share of skeptics, are beginning to take hold even as its core search and advertising business continues to hum. Google continues to gain momentum and beat even the highest expectations, said Clayton Moran, an analyst at Benchmark Co. , will work mainly in London, Munich and Zurich and be split between technology and sales. Announcing the plan at a conference in Munich yesterday( 25 January), outgoing chief executive Eric Schmidt says: We looked at this year and our prospects for growth in Europe, and our businesses globally are doing well, both our core business and our adjacent businesses.
